  • Field Details

    • ROLL_COOL_DOWN

      public long ROLL_COOL_DOWN

    • ROLL_LENGTH

      public int ROLL_LENGTH

    • ROLL_TIME

      public double ROLL_TIME

  • Constructor Details

    • RollComponent

      public RollComponent()

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Handles checking the roll status per frame
      Overrides:
      update in class Component

    • updateRollEnd

      public void updateRollEnd()
      Updates the time that the player's current roll will end, based on the time the roll started. All roll times are in absolute milliseconds since game start.

    • checkRollStatus

      public void checkRollStatus()
      Handles checking if the player needs to stop rolling, and whether they can roll again based on the cool down. - If the ROLL_TIME is up, and the player is rolling, they will stop rolling. - If the ROLL_COOL_DOWN has worn off since the last roll, the player is able to roll again.

    • handleStopRolling

      public void handleStopRolling()
      Calls set-down code for rolling; the player is set to not rolling, and will stop rolling. The roll cool-down begins. If they have fallen off something while rolling, this is handled.

    • setRolling

      public void setRolling​(boolean rolling)
      Sets the player's 'rolling' status.
      Parameters:
      rolling - true if the player is not rolling, else false.

    • handleRolling

      public void handleRolling​(Vector2 direction)
      Set-up code for rolling. The roll start time is logged, the player is set to rolling and the new roll ending time is updated. The player then rolls in the given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction the player will roll in, either LEFT or RIGHT.

    • cantRoll

      public boolean cantRoll()
      Returns whether the player can roll based on whether or not they are currently on a roll cool-down
      Returns:
      true if the player is on cool-down, else false.

    • setCoolDown

      public void setCoolDown​(boolean coolDownStatus)
      Triggers the roll cool-down on or off. The player cannot roll while they are on a cool-down.
      Parameters:
      coolDownStatus - true to set the cool-down to on, else false to turn it off.

    • getCoolDownRemaining

      public double getCoolDownRemaining()
      Returns the time remaining on the roll cool-down. Once this value hits 0, it will continue into negatives until the player rolls again. Hence, 0 is the minimum bound returned.
      Returns:
      the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the player has remaining on the roll cool-down.

    • getLastRollEnded

      public double getLastRollEnded()
      Returns the time at which the most recent roll ended, in absolute milliseconds since game start.
      Returns:
      the time (in milliseconds since game start) that the player stopped rolling

    • setLastRollStarted

      public void setLastRollStarted​(long rollStart)
      Sets the time at which the player started their roll.
      Parameters:
      rollStart - the time, in absolute milliseconds since game start, that the player began rolling.

    • getRolling

      public boolean getRolling()
      Returns whether or not the player is currently rolling.
      Returns:
      true if the player is mid-roll, else false.

    • getLastRollStarted

      public long getLastRollStarted()
      Returns the time at which the player started their current, or most recent roll.
      Returns:
      the time, in absolute milliseconds since game start, that the player started their current or most recent roll.

    • animateRoll

      public void animateRoll()
      Starts the roll animation when the player rolls

    • stopRollAnimation

      public void stopRollAnimation()
      Returns the player to their previous state after rolling
